metadata.title: Wednesday, 24th June, 2015
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the roof of the classroom block at Bengamufipa Primary School in Chasefu Parliamentary Constituency, which was blown off, will be replaced;
(b)    what the cause of the delay is;
(c)    what the cost of the works is; and
(d)    what the time-frame for completion of the works is.
(a)    how much revenue was lost when the Nakonde Border Post was closed in March, 2015, due to disturbances in Tanzania; and

(b)    whether there are any plans to mitigate such losses in the future and, if so, how. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W50    Mr Namulambe (Mpongwe) - to ask the Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry:
(a)    what the total number of registered second-hand motor vehicle dealers  country wide is, province by province; and
(b)    of the number above, how many are owned by foreign nationals. W51    Mr Mucheleka (Lubansenshi) - to ask the Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health:
(a)    how many women clubs in Lubansenshi Parliamentary Constituency were funded from January, 2013 to April, 2015, year by year;
(b)    what the names of the clubs are; and
(c)    how much money was disbursed to each club. W52    Mr Mutelo (Lukulu West) - to ask the Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication:
(a)    how much money was spent on periodic maintenance of the Katunda-Lukulu – Mumbezhi road during the following periods:
(i)    January – December, 2013; (ii)    January – December, 2014; and (iii)    January – April, 2015;
(b)    why the maintenance works always end at Lukulu Civic Centre, leaving out the Lukulu – Mumbezhi stretch;
(c)    when the stretch from Lukulu Civic Centre to Watopa Pontoon will be rehabilitated; and
(d)    when the upgrading of the road, from Katunda to Mumbezhi will commence, considering that feasibility studies have been completed. W53    Mr Chipungu (Rufunsa) - to ask the Vice President:
(a)    what the current population of people in Zambia is, province by province;
(b)    which province is most densely populated; and

(c)    whether the Government has any plans to partition the most densely populated province to facilitate effective service delivery. W54    Mr Miyanda (Mapatizya) - to ask the Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry:
(a)    how many people from Zimba District applied for funding from the Citizens Economic Empowerment Commission in 2014;
(b)    how many applicants were successful;
(c)    of the successful applicants, how many were:
(i)    women; (ii)    men; and (iii)    youths;
(d)    how much money, in total, was disbursed to the District; and
(e)    what criteria were used to select the successful applicants. W55    Mr Miyanda (Mapatizya) - to ask the Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health:
(a)    how many qualified medical personnel were stationed at the following health centres in Mapatizya Parliamentary Constituency as of April, 2015:
(i)    Simwatachela; (ii)    Siamafumba; (iii)    Luyaba; (iv)    Mapatizya; and
(v)    Simalundu;
(b)    what the staff establishment for each centre is; and
(c)    when all the centres will be adequately staffed. W56    Mr Miyanda (Mapatizya) - to ask the Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education:
(a)    how many schools were provided with computers as of April, 2015:
(i)    province by province; and (ii)    in Mapatizya Parliamentary Constituency;
(b)    what the total value of the computers at (a) is;
(c)    how many teachers were trained to teach computer subjects as of April, 2015:
(i)    province by province; and (ii)    in Mapatizya Parliamentary Constituency;
(d)    whether the teachers and computers were adequate for the schools countrywide; and
(e)    if not, when the shortfall will be met. W57    Mr Namulambe (Mpongwe) - to ask the Minister of Local Government and Housing:
(a)    how much money, in salary arrears, was owed to council employees, country-wide, as of April, 2015;
(b)    how many councils were affected, province by province;
(c)    which category of employees was affected most;
(d)    what has caused the delay in paying the salaries;
(e)    when the employees will be paid; and
(f)    by how many months the salary arrears were, province by province.
